What is Arduino?.answer: Arduino is an open-source electronics platform used to build projects like robots, LED systems, and sensor devices. It has a hardware board and software called Arduino IDE. We write programs and upload them to the board to control electronic parts.

What is a microcontroller?.answer: A microcontroller is a small computer on a single chip. It has a processor, memory and input/output pins. Arduino uses a microcontroller to control devices.

What is Arduino IDE?.answer: Arduino IDE is a software used to write, compile and upload programs to the Arduino board.

What is a sketch?.answer: A sketch is the name given to an Arduino program.

What is setup() function?.answer: setup() runs only once when Arduino starts. It is used to set pin modes and initialize things.

What is loop() function?.answer: loop() runs again and again forever. It contains the main logic of the program.

What is pinMode()?.answer: pinMode() is used to set a pin as INPUT or OUTPUT.

What is digitalWrite()?.answer: digitalWrite() is used to set a digital pin HIGH or LOW.

What is digitalRead()?.answer: digitalRead() reads the value from a digital pin.

What is delay()?.answer: delay() pauses the program for some time in milliseconds.

What is a variable?.answer: A variable is used to store data in a program. The value can change while the program is running.

What is if statement?.answer: if statement checks a condition and runs code only if the condition is true.

What is if-else?.answer: if-else is used to choose between two conditions.

What is for loop?.answer: for loop repeats a block of code a fixed number of times.

What is while loop?.answer: while loop repeats code while a condition is true.

What is a function?.answer: A function is a block of code that can be reused.

What is a constant?.answer: A constant is a value that does not change during program execution.

What are comments?.answer: Comments explain the code and are ignored by the compiler.

What is Serial Monitor?.answer: Serial Monitor shows data from Arduino to the computer.

What is baud rate?.answer: Baud rate is the speed of communication between Arduino and computer.

LED Blink.answer: This program blinks an LED every one second.

Two LEDs Alternately Blink.answer: This program blinks two LEDs one after another.

Button Control LED.answer: This program turns ON LED when button is pressed.

Traffic Light.answer: This program works like a traffic signal using three LEDs.

LED Fade using PWM.answer: This program increases and decreases LED brightness slowly.

Buzzer Beep.answer: This program turns buzzer ON and OFF.

What is a sensor?.answer: A sensor detects changes like temperature, light or distance.

What is ultrasonic sensor?.answer: Ultrasonic sensor measures distance using sound waves.

What is LDR?.answer: LDR changes resistance based on light.

What is DC motor?.answer: A DC motor is an electrical device that converts direct current (DC) electrical energy into mechanical motion (rotation).

What is servo motor?.answer: Servo motor moves to fixed angles.

Why motor driver needed?.answer: Arduino cannot supply enough current to motors.

What is L298N?.answer: L298N is a motor driver module.

Why external power needed?.answer: Motors need more current than Arduino can supply.

What is voltage?.answer: Voltage pushes current in a circuit.

What is current?.answer: Current is the flow of electricity.

What is ESP32?.answer: ESP32 is a microcontroller with WiFi and Bluetooth.

What is IoT?.answer: IoT means Internet of Things. Devices can send data using internet.

Arduino vs ESP32?.answer: ESP32 is faster and has WiFi. Arduino is simpler.
